In the work shown, The Valley of Mexico from the Hillside of Santa Isabel (El Valle de México desde el Cerro de Santa Isabel), José María Velasco uses landscape painting to

choices.label: celebrate the modernization of a newly independent Mexico with his audience
reflect themes of Mexican patriotism and national identity important to his audience
help his audience to imagine what Mexico looked like before the arrival of the Spanish
represent Mexico to his audience as a place ripe for foreign industrial investment

topic.text: 4.2: Purpose and Audience in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
